msItem.title: Deuteronomy, according to the Peshitta version

item.p: One leaf is much torn.

layout.p: There are from 28 to 32 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: Written in a good, regular hand of the9th century, with occasional Syriac vowels.

msItem.title: Hosea, translated from the Septuagint
msItem.rubric: ܟܬܒܒ ܕܬܪܥܣܪ̈ ܢܒ̈ܝܐ ܐܝܟ ܡܫܠܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܫܒܥܝܢ
msItem.note: Originally the twelve minor prophets, translated from the Septuagint by Paul of Tellā. There now remains only Hosea, ch. i. 1 — v. 15.
The text exhibits the critical marks of theHexapla , and the margins contain the various readings ofAquila ,Symmachus , andTheodotion , and some explanatory notes.

item.p: Thefirst foliois slightly torn.

layout.p: There are from 23 to 26 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the8th century.

msItem.title: Hosea, according to the Peshitta version
Amos, according to the Peshitta version
Obadiah, according to the Peshitta version
Habakkuk, according to the Peshitta version
Zephaniah, according to the Peshitta version

item.p: Thefirst folioandlast folioare much torn.

layout.p: There are two columns in each page, of from 25 to 29 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a good, regular Nestorian Estrangela of the7th century.

item.p: The Syriac vowels seem to have been added by a somewhat later hand.

msItem.title: Isaiah, according to the Peshitta version
Hosea, according to the Peshitta version
Joel, according to the Peshitta version
Amos, according to the Peshitta version
Jeremiah, according to the Peshitta version

item.p: All leaves are much soiled and torn.

layout.p: There are from 31 to 34 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is a neat, regular, Nestorian Estrangela of the8th century.

item.p: Fol. 20 has been used as a fly-leaf for another manuscript, and across it is written a note in one of the usual forms:
item.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܣܩܛܐ. ܟܠ ܕܡܦܩ ܠܗ ܡܢ ܗܕܐ ܕܝܪܐ ܐܘ ܟܐܡ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܘ܏ܫ

msItem.title: Ezekiel, translated from the Septuagint version
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܚ[ܙܩܝܐܝܠ] ܢܒܝܐ ܐܝܟ ܡܫܠܡܢـ[ܘܬܐ ܕ]ܫܒܥܝܢ

item.p: The leaves are much stained and torn.
These folia formed the 14th and last quire (ܝܕ) of a manuscript.

layout.p: There are from 23 to 25 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of theviiith cent.

item.p: The hexaplar marks are exhibited, but only one marginal variant is noted.

handNote.desc: Written in a good, regular, apparently Nestorian hand of the9th century.

msItem.author: Theodore of Mopsuestia
msItem.title: Portions of the Commentary of Theodore of Mopsuestia on the twelve minor Prophets
msItem.note: See the original Greek in Mai, Scriptorum Veterum Nova Collectio, t. vi., or Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. lxvi., col. 124.
These fragments have been edited by Dr. Sachau, with the corresponding Greek text, in "Theodori Mopsuesteni Fragmenta Syriaca," Leipzig, 1869.

msItem.title: Commentary on Hosea, ch. viii. 7—12

item.p: Five vellum leaves, about 10 1/4 in. by 6 1/2, the second and third of which are much torn (Add. 14,668, foll. 32—36.). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 27 to 29 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangělā, of the vith cent.

msItem.author: Daniel of Salach
msItem.title: Fragments of the second volume of the Commentary of Daniel of Salach on the Psalms, viz. part of the homilies on Pss. li., lviii., and lxii
msItem.rubric: [ܟܬܒ]ـܐ ܕܬܪܝܢ ܕܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܡܙܡܘܪ̈ܐ ܕܥܒܕ ܪܚܡ ܐܠܗܐ [ܩܫܝܫ]ـܐ ܕܢܝܐܝܠ ܡܠܦܢܐ. ܠܘܬ ܚܣܝܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ [ܝܘܚܢـ]ـܢ ܪܝܫ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ [ܕܛܘ]ܒܬܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܘܣܒ [ܕܟܦ]ܪܐ ܕܒܪܬܐ ܕܒܟܘܪܐ ܕܐܘܦܡܝܐ.

item.p: Three vellum leaves, about 10 in. by 6 5/8, the first of which is much stained and torn. Each page is divided into two columns of from 38 to 41 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of the ixth or xth cent.

msItem.title: Part of the history of Pachomius
Other extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers

msItem.author: Isaiah of Scete
msItem.title: Fragments of the writings of Isaiah of Scete

item.p: Four vellum leaves, about 9 7/8 in. by 6 7/8, all more or less soiled and torn (Add. 14,668, foll. 40—43). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 27 to 32 lines.

handNote.desc: They are written in a good, regular hand; dated A. Gr. 1177, A.D. 866.

item.p: On fol. 13 b there are notes, giving the date and other particulars regarding the volume, of which, however, the greater part is no longer clearly legible.

p.quote: ܐܫܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܐܫܥܝܐ ܐܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܡܐܐ ܘܫܒ̈ܥܝܢ ܘܫܒ̈ܥ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ ܒܪ ܦـ[ـܝܠܦܘܣ] ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ John III. See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., p. 348; Le Quien, Or. Christ., t. ii., col. 1374. ܦܛܪܝܪܟܝܣ ܕܟܘܪܣܝܐ ܫܠܝܚܝܐ ܕܐܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.note: The second letter is probably of Severus based on the rubric

item.p: A vellum leaf, 10 1/2 in. in length, much mutilated. The writing is in two columns of from 29 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

msItem.author: John Chrysostom
msItem.title: the conclusion of a discourse of John Chrysostom on the second coming of our Lord and on the Antichrist
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ: ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ: ܕܥܠ ܡܬܝܬܗ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܬܪ̈ܬܝܐ: ܘܥܠ ܐܢܛܝܟܪܝܣܛܘܣ ـܲـ .

item.p: A vellum leaf, 9 7/8 in. by 7, slightly torn. The writing is in double columns of 29 lines. It is the last leaf of a volume

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the viiith or ixth cent.

item.p: On the verso there is a note, in the usual form, relating to the donation of the abbat Moses of Nisibis to the library of the convent of S. Mary Deipara, A. Gr. 1243, A.D. 932.

msItem.title: Selections from the book called the Climax (Ladder, or Book of Steps), two discourses of Marcus the monk, two discourses of Xystus, and extracts from John the monk
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܡܕܡ ܕܓܒ̇ܝܢܢ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܡ̈ܣܩܬܐ. ܘܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܕܡܪܩܘܣ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ. ܘܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܕܟܣܘܣܛܘܣ. ܘܡܢ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ.

item.p: A vellum leaf, mutilated at the top. It is dated A. Gr. 1199, A.D. 888, and was the last leaf of a manuscript. The writing is in double columns of about 37 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is small and regular.

item.p: The colophon states that the manuscript was written by one Joseph of Ḥarran , in the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܐܫܬ݀ܠܡ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܟܘ̈ܢܫܐ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܏ܘܩܨܛ ܒܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ. ܟܬܒܗ ܕܝܢ ܠܢܦܫܗ ܘܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܦܓܥܝܢ ܝܘܣܦ ܐܚܐ ܡܢ ܚܪܢ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ. ܕܡܪܝܐ ܢܥܒܕ ܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: The later note on the verso is mutilated at the beginning, and much effaced throughout.

origin.origPlace: the convent of S. Mary Deipara

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.category: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons
